current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Public Health Services Act to provide
		  research, training, and navigator services to youth and young adults on the
		  verge of aging out of the secondary educational system, and for other
		  purposes.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Health, Education, Labor,
			 and Pensions

comprehensive

services to

text.#text:
community-based
				behavioral supports and interventions;

community-based
				integrated residential services, housing, and transportation;

nutrition,
				health and wellness, recreational, and social activities; and

personal safety
				services that consider the specific needs of transitioning youth who are at
				risk of becoming involved with public safety agencies or the criminal justice
				system;

culturally and
				linguistically competent and sensitive service delivery models; and

proposals which
				seek to—

increase the
				efficiency of service delivery to maximize resources and outcomes; and

ensure access to
				all services identified as necessary to transitioning youth of all
				capabilities.

Grants awarded under this subsection shall be for a period
				of 2 years.
